title: Has A. R. Rehman ever copied the song of another artist? If so, what song? - Quora

response.answer_text: Hindi Songs: Nazrein Milana (prelude) from Jaane Tu Yaa Jaane Naa is copied from Bum Bum Bole (prelude) from Taare Zameen Par originally composed by Shankar-Ehsaan-Loy. Heer Toh Badi Sad Hai from Tamasha is copied from Bedardi Raja from Delhi Belly originally composed by Ram Sampath. Tere Bina (Dum Tara) from Guru is copied from Aao Naa (prelude and interlude) from Kyon! Ho Gaya Na originally composed by Shankar-Ehsaan-Loy. Jai Ho from Slumdog Millionaire is copied from Jaaneman Jaaneman from Choti Si Baat originally composed by Salil Chaudhary. Tu Hi Tu from Kabhi Na Kabhi is copied from Scarborough Fair by Simon and Garfunkel! Song. This song had Rahman’s music and the beginning of the song sounds so much like The Scarborough Fair by Simon and Garfunkel! Luka Chhupi (prelude) from Rang De Basanti is copied from Dogs by Pink Floyd. The intro Guitar is a straight rip from the intro that comes in a song called “Dogs” by Pink Floyd. Background score from Rangeela and a lot of the songs in there: Are a direct inspiration from music by Deep Forest (their first album, the one with a green color album cover). Rubaroo from Rang de Basanti is copied from Deep Blue Something by Breakfast at Tiffany. This song has striking resemblance to and feels inspired from Breakfast at Tiffany of Deep Blue Something. Tu bin bataye from Rang de Basanti is Copied from Kaempfert's mid-20th century creation. Theme music of Bombay is copied from a backgorund score or a song from Wyaat Earp. Mangta hai kya from Rangeela is copied from Devil inside(INXS) Vande Mataram (music album) is Copied from Loreena Mc kennet, Mystics Dream and another albums Challa From Jab Tak Hai Jaan is copied from Save Tonight By Eagle Eye Cherry in 1997. Chiggy Wiggy from Blue is copied from Baby It’s You by JoJo Feat. Bow Wow in 2004 (only background music is copied).  Tamil Songs: Kuluvaalile from Muthu is copied from Rescue Me by Fontella Bass in 1965. Poopookkum Osai from Minsara Kanuvu (Awara Bhanwre from Sapnay in Hindi) is copied from original Song – Lebo M’s ‘Rhythm of pride lands: Kube in 1995. Endrendrum Punnagai from Alaipayuthey (O Humdum Suniyo Re from Saathiya in Hindi) is copied from Everybody by Backstreet Boys in 1996 (only background music is copied). Urvasi Urvasi from Kadhalan (Humse Hai Muqabla in Hindi) is copied from Music and Lights by Imagination in 1982 (only background music is copied). Thenmerku Paruvakatru from Karuthamma is Copied from original Song – Dr Alban, ‘Om we rembwe ike in 1992. Telephone Manipol from Indian (Telephone Dhun Mein Hasne Waali from Hindustani in Hindi) is copied from All That She Wants by Ace of Base in 1992. Oru Ponnu Onnu Naan Paarthen from Kushi is copied from One Love by Dr. Alban in 1992. Mukkala Muqabala from Kaadhalan (Humse Hai Muqabla in Hindi) is copied from Mata oh a eh by Dr. Alban in 1992. Thillana Thillana from Muthu is Copied from original Song – Night Bird by Deep Forest in 1992. En Vettu Thotathil (Roop Suhana Lagta Hai in Hindi) from Gentleman is copied from Eddem Ante Teddam Antav from Chik Pak Chik Bum by Malgudi Subha in 1991 and Nadhavindhu (Thiruppugazh) a devotional song. Akkadanu Nanga from Indian (Latka Dikha Diya Humne from Hindustani in Hindi) is Copied from original Song – Paul Young’s ‘Love of common people in 1983 (only background music is copied). Thaiyya Thaiyya from Uyirae (Chaiyya Chaiyya from Dil Se in Hindi) is copied from The Corr’s “Silver Strand”. Paakathe Paakathey From Gentlemen is copied from Osibisa’s Kelele Kelele in 1971. Nadhiye Nadhiya from Rhythm is copied from Strange Kind of Woman by DEEP PURPLE in 1972. Pudhu Vellai Mazhai (Yeh Haseen Waadiyaan in Hindi) from Roja is copied from Yanni's track, Quiet Man in 1989 and Chariots of Fire by Vangelis in 1981. Hello Mr. Ethirkatchi from Iruvar is Copied from original Song – Dave Grusin’s Memphis Stomp in 1993. Background score of Enthiran (Robot in Hindi) (in end credits) is copied from the Intro Theme music from the 2008/2009 Chinese epic war film called Red Cliff. Anbe Anbe from Jeans is copied from Peter Gabriel's 'Of these, hope...' from the album 'Passion: Music from the last temptation of Christ' in 1989. Ennai Kaanavillayae From Kaadhal Desam is copied from Enigma’s Sadeness (Hallelujah) in 1991. Hosanna from Vinnaithaandi Varuvaayaa (Ekk Deewana Tha in Hindi) is copied from Birthmark by Akon in 2008. Aaromale from Vinnaithaandi Varuvaayaa (Ekk Deewana Tha in Hindi) is copied from Dark Side of the Moon by Pink Floyd in 1973 and Dave Matthews Band - #27 in 2007. Omana Penne from Vinnaithaandi Varuvaayaa (Phoolon Jaisi Ladki from Ekk Deewana Tha in Hindi) is copied from One More Chance by Michael Jackson in 2003. Indian National Anthem by A R Rahman is copied from Conquest of Paradise by Vangelis in 1992 (only background music is copied). Yaakai Thiri from Aaytha Ezhuthu (Fanaa from Yuva in Hindi) is copied from Jump for Joy by 2 Unlimited in 1996. Shakalaka Baby from Mudhalvan (Nayak - The Real Hero in Hindi) is copied from Ain’t talkin bout dub by Apollo 440 in 1997 and The State of Bengal Flight IC 408 in 1998. Taxi Taxi from Sakkarakatti is copied from Impacto by Daddy Yankee in 2006 (only background music is copied). Background score of the Theatrical Trailer of Shankar’s I (which released on 18th December 2014) is copied from the background score of the Theatrical Trailer of Furious 7 (which released on 1st November 2014).

I'm not sure if this falls under the category of copying, but the starting tunes of the song 'Kaise Mujhe' from Ghajini and 'Only One' by Yellowcard are almost identical. But I feel that this is a mere coincidence. Check them out .
